Legal_Issue: Can a previous judgment dismissing a refugee claim be set aside due to newly discovered evidence of inadequate representation and failure to protect the minor's interests?
Outcome: Motion allowed, original judgment set aside, Dequan permitted to refile information for his refugee claim.
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application initially dismissed, motion filed under Rule 399(2)(a) to set aside the judgment based on new evidence.
Evidence_Type: Newly discovered evidence of inadequate representation and procedural failures
Legal_Provision: Rule 399(2)(a) of the Federal Courts Rules
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inadequate representation and procedural failures leading to abandonment of claim
Proceeding_Type: Judicial review, motion to set aside judgment
Application_Error: Failure to ensure proper representation of a minor, neglect in protecting the minor's interests
Evidence_Ignored: Key proceedings and documents not communicated to the minor
Legal_Standard: New matter could not have been discovered earlier with due diligence and would have influenced the original decision
Application_Factor: Dequan Evans was a minor and unaware of proceedings due to mother's unsuitability and counsel's negligence
Decision_Outcome: Previous judgment set aside, case remitted to RPD, claim deemed not abandoned
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether judgment should be set aside based on new evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule 399(2)(a) of the Federal Courts Rules
Outcome_of_Review: Original judgment set aside, case remitted
Evidentiary_Issues: New evidence of lack of awareness and procedural neglect
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to protect minor's right to fair process
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Motion to set aside judgment under Rule 399(2)(a)
Procedural_Issue: Abandonment of claim due to inadequate representation
Omission_Type: Failure to inform minor of key proceedings and documents
